Shannon Lloyd Visits Mindkind Projects, Emphasises Support for Local Initiatives
Today, Shannon Lloyd, the Conservative parliamentary candidate for Walsall and Bloxwich, visited Mindkind Projects, a local organisation based in Walsall. Accompanied by Andy Street, the former West Midlands Mayor, and local councillors, the visit underscored her commitment to supporting organisations that benefit residents and businesses in Walsall, Bloxwich, and the wider Midlands.
Hosted by Nike Morris, Shannon toured the facilities and learned about the various courses, training, and research initiatives offered by Mindkind Projects. During the visit, Shannon engaged with staff and participants, gaining insights into the positive impact of the organisation’s work.
"You cannot help but be impressed and amazed by the impact this organisation has on local residents and the wider community. I had the opportunity to chat with some of those attending a session today and was delighted to hear their positive feedback on the difference Mindkind Projects is making to them," Shannon said.
Looking Ahead
The visit highlighted Shannon’s determination to support local businesses and organisations. "I am committed to helping organisations like Mindkind Projects raise their profile, secure funds, and assist as many people as possible," Shannon stated. She emphasised the importance of grassroots initiatives in fostering community spirit and providing essential services.
As her campaign progresses, Shannon will continue spotlighting the work of local enterprises that enhance the quality of life for residents in Walsall and Bloxwich. Her proactive approach aims to create a network of support and collaboration among local entities, ensuring sustainable development and community well-being.
Shannon's dedication to her hometown is evident through her continuous efforts to engage with and uplift local organisations. By promoting such initiatives, she aims to inspire collective action and highlight the transformative power of community-driven projects.
For more information about the work of Mindkind Projects, please visit Mindkind Projects.

This accessibility statement relates to this website, which is part of the Bluetree website platform.
It is important to make websites accessible to the widest possible audience. Therefore this site has been designed to meet the Web Content Accessibility Guidelines 2.1 AA, but also satisfies many other checkpoints laid out in the Guidelines for level AAA.
These guidelines are intended to make website content accessible to people with disabilities. They also help to ensure that slower devices and Internet connections do not impede substantially on navigating the website.
Therefore, you should be able to:-
- Zoom in up to 300% without test spilling off the screen using your web browser settings. For example, in Chrome, hold down the ctrl key and press the + and - keys. In Safari, hold down the cmd key and press the + and - keys.
- Navigate most of the website using a keyboard
- Navigate most of the website using speech recognition software
- Listen to most of the website with a screen reader
- Read most of the website with a Braille device
AbilityNet has advice on making your device easier to use if you have additional access needs.
What we do to improve accessibility
The website administrator is responsible for the accessibility of this website. However, the developers regularly review design and functionality accessibility on the website platform, including:-
- Improving layouts and colours to enhance simplicity and contrast
- Ensuring that text appears in a legible font size
- Ensuring that tap targets are an accessible size and not too small or close together
- Considering accessibility in all design and functionality decisions
- Publishing best practice for website administrators relating to content accessibility
How accessible is the website platform?
Due to the devolved nature of the administration of a website platform, the responsibility for accessibility of content rests with the content creators. The developers are aware of the potential to add or modify content that is not as accessible as it could be, including:-
- Images used as links
- Broken links
- Text as images in some locations, such as infographics and logos, without supportive descriptions
- Non-optimal images and pdfs, such as scanned letters
- Some historic images lack alternative text (prior to August 2016, when alt text became mandatory on the platform)
- Not all videos feature subtitles and/or descriptive text
The developers of the website platform have no control over nor can take any responsibility for the content added to the website, but strive to resolve these where possible through aspects of the functionality as well as integral and disseminated best practice. It is entirely possible for all of these accessibility issues to be resolved by content creators themselves.
Browser accessibility
This website has been optimised for the latest versions of the following browsers:-
- Google Chrome
- Mozilla Firefox
- Apple Safari
- Microsoft Edge
If the website does not display correctly, please update to the latest version of your browser.
How to request information in an accessible format
This website has its own administrator and if you need information in a different format, please contact that individual using the form or details on the Contact page in the menu. Alternatively, you can write to the address in the footer if one appears.
Reporting accessibility problems
This website has its own administrator and if you find any problems that are not listed on this page or if you think the website is not meeting accessibility requirements, please contact the administrator using the form or details on the Contact page in the menu. Alternatively, you can write to the address in the footer if one appears. If necessary, information about structural or design accessibility issues will be passed to the developers to include in the development roadmap.
If you contact us with a complaint about accessibility and you are not happy with our response, contact the Equality Advisory and Support Service (EASS).
From time to time, other website developers copy this Accessibility statement for use on their own websites. This statement applies exclusively to the accessibility of genuine Bluetree websites and is unlikely to be valid on other platforms, websites or servers. We have no control over website developers who copy this statement for their own purposes, which is a breach of copyright, but if you are reading this on a genuine Bluetree website, you will see 'Powered by Bluetree' at the bottom of the footer.
Version: 2302S

Today, Shannon Lloyd, the Conservative Parliamentary Candidate for Walsall and Bloxwich, visited Bloxwich Pharmacy on the High Street in Bloxwich. The visit further demonstrates Shannon’s commitment to supporting local businesses and our High Streets.
Invited by Indi Kaur to tour the new facilities the Pharmacy has invested in to increase the services on offer to the local community, Shannon was able to meet staff and take a closer look at the new consulting suite. The visit allowed Shannon to see cutting edge technology used in the Pharmacy to dispense prescriptions and acknowledge the role this Pharmacy played during the role out of the COVID vaccine when it was the first in the local area to offer the vaccine to vulnerable residents.
“Great visit to Bloxwich Pharmacy today thanks to Indi and Jas. Walsall and Bloxwich can be justifiably proud of this particular Pharmacy and its wonderful staff who are utilising cutting edge technology to serve the community and investing in consulting rooms to offer a broad range of services alongside the Pharmacy First initiative already in place. If you are in there have a look at the robot pharmacist which looks like the tubes carrying chocolate in Charlie and the Chocolate Factory to me. I will always support local businesses who are serving their community and creating jobs.”
Looking Ahead
This type of visit highlights Shannon’s determination to support local businesses and our high streets. Shannon will continue to engage and promote local businesses shining a spotlight on the vital role they play for residents in Walsall and Bloxwich.
For more information on the services offered by Bloxwich Pharmacy, please visit @BloxwichChemist

Shannon Lloyd, candidate for Walsall and Bloxwich, visited Alamgeer Foods, an internationally successful family-run business based in Walsall, today. This visit highlights her commitment to supporting local enterprises and job creation in the community.
Supporting Local Economy and Job Creation
Founded in 1979, Alamgeer Foods has grown from a small food store into a major player in the Asian culinary market, now operating out of a 40,000 square-foot warehouse. Shannon toured the facilities, met with the owners and staff, and learned about the company’s journey and contributions to the local economy. She praised Alamgeer Foods for its role in providing stable employment for local residents and fostering economic growth.
"It's truly inspiring to see how Alamgeer Foods has not only achieved international success but also remained deeply committed to its roots here in Walsall," Shannon remarked. "Their efforts in creating employment opportunities and supporting local initiatives are invaluable to our community."
Community Engagement and Corporate Responsibility
In addition to job creation, Alamgeer Foods is actively involved in various community projects and charitable initiatives. The company is committed to responsible trading practices and environmental conservation, working towards Fair Trade accreditation. Shannon lauded their corporate responsibility, stating, "Their commitment to giving back to the community sets a powerful example for other businesses. It's encouraging to see such strong corporate citizenship in action."
A Vision for the Future
Shannon Lloyd’s visit underscores her focus on economic development and community support as key components of her campaign. She believes that fostering a business-friendly environment and supporting local enterprises are crucial for the prosperity of Walsall and Bloxwich. "This visit has reinforced my belief that we must continue to support and nurture our local businesses. They are the backbone of our economy and play a vital role in our community's well-being. I am committed to advocating for policies that help businesses thrive and create more job opportunities for our residents," she stated.
Looking Ahead
As Shannon continues her campaign, she plans to visit more local businesses and engage with community members to better understand their needs and aspirations. Her goal is to develop and promote policies that will drive economic growth, support local enterprises, and enhance the quality of life for all residents in Walsall and Bloxwich.
Residents can look forward to a campaign that is deeply rooted in understanding and addressing the real-world challenges faced by businesses and individuals alike. Shannon Lloyd’s dedication to public service and her proactive approach promise to bring positive change and effective representation to the constituency.
For more updates on Shannon Lloyd’s campaign and her initiatives, visit her personal website and follow her on social media.
